channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown bushes/trees affecting parking, 6th September
item.description:
The bushes and vegetation/trees are completely overgrown for the whole length of Murray Avenue between Rochester Avenue and Harwood Avenue. This means that it is virtually impossible to park in the free bays within the painted lines without scratching the paint on the side of the car. It also means you cannot get in/out of the car if you are on that side of the car. Car owners should be able to park in this road without having to worry about a traffic warden coming along and issuing a parking ticket for not being parked within the confines of the bay. It is obvious that the Council have not been maintaining this street for vegetation for some time and it could really do with some attention please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lift in the Stockwell close multi story car park not working, 6th September
item.description:
The lift in the car park is STILL not working after many many months - unacceptable and and important route for residents using prams and wheelchairs accessing the glades
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Close, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Uninsured van, 6th September
item.description:

item.title: Special Needs Boy Pushing children over in playground, 6th September
item.description:
Disabled/Special needs boy in playground with carer for 3/4 hours a day, shouting and making noise. Carer is on his phone for duration. Special Needs boy has now pushed a child over in what is supposed to be the estates playground. Please advise or sort
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering suggest remove this public bin altogether, 6th September
item.description:
Repeated fly tipping next to public bin. Suggest to remove from residential area altogether.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish in walkway., 6th September
item.description:
The walkway between Langdon Road and Kentish Way has a lot of rubbish (paper, drink cartons etc) in it. The leaves are to be expected this time if year, but the rubbish is increasing. This is an ongoing problem, as many people use it as a "cut through", but it has become worse during the past few weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langdon Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Skate park ,music DJ noise and many people, 6th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meeson Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Alarm is misfiring very load, 6th September
